scenarioDescription:
The HD 110082 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 110082 is a star with 1.21 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.19 times its radius. It is located 342.78 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.25 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 110082 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 110082 system


HD 110082 b

HD 110082 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 110082 b is 10.335 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 110082 b is 3.200 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 110082 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 110082, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: HD 110082 - System With 1 Exoplanet
